artefact.alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for examination grants
artefact.overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers providing cash awards for exam success

parts.title: Overview
parts.body:
As an employer awarding examination grants to your employees, you have certain tax, National Insurance and reporting obligations.

What’s included

An examination grant is classed as a one-off cash awards for exam success.

parts.title: What's exempt
parts.body:
You don’t have to report anything to HMRC or pay tax and National Insurance if all of the following apply:

  • your employee earns at a rate of less than £8,500 per year
  • the award is discretionary – ie you’re under no legal obligation to provide it
  • it’s not part of the employee’s duties to pass the exam
  • the award is a one-off lump sum payment
  • the award is reasonable and there’s no evidence that it’s a disguised bonus

parts.title: What to report and pay
parts.body:
If the examination grant isn’t exempt, it counts as earnings, so you’ll need to:

  • add the payment to your employee’s other earnings
  • deduct and pay PAYE tax and Class 1 National Insurance through payroll
